title: Records request related to Kentucky Medicaid

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Records request related to Kentucky Medicaid
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

-A copy of any and all recordings of the town hall meeting to discuss Medicaid issues held on September 7, 2023 between CHFS officials and outside stakeholders, including kynectors, Kentucky Voices for Health, and the Kentucky Equal Justice Center.
-A copy of the written questions CHFS received from the aforementioned town hall meeting and the cabinet’s responses.
-A copy of the change order referenced in part 1.3 of the attached letter dated September 19, 2023 from the Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services to the Kentucky Equal Justice Center, which states: “While the Cabinet acknowledges that there is currently a system barrier for an SSI ineligible individual to submit an application through the Self Service Portal (SSP) in kynect prior to termination, the individual may submit an application to DCBS through various other ways identified in the notice. A change order has been submitted to remove the system SSP barrier…”
-Copies of all emails, attachments, text messages and other communications sent between CHFS personnel and employees of Deloitte Consulting whose email domains include “@deloitte.com” between January 1, 2023 and the date of your final response.

Please note that I am a member of the news media as evidenced by my published work for KFF Health News at www.kffhealthnews.org and its numerous news partners, and this request is being made for news gathering purposes. I also request that fees be waived as this request is in the public interest. 

All questions, requests for payment or copies of records can be routed to myself at this email address or via phone at 703-731-7918. Please note that I am a citizen of Virginia, and am using MuckRock's services to help manage and track my request.

Sincerely,
Rachana Pradhan

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rachana Pradhan

title: Jacob MacWilliam Marine Corps service records

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Jacob MacWilliam Marine Corps service records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The Official Military Personnel File (OMPF) for Jacob MacWilliam (DOB: November 25, 1991), including Form DD-214, all Fitness Report and Counseling forms , Enlisted performance evaluation reports, administrative remarks, Cumulative Record of Training, history of assignments, dates of promotions, Marine Corps training history, all military decoration and full award citations, all military education/training courses.

Please also include:

- Service Number

- Dates of Service

- Branch of Service

- Final Duty Status

- Final Rank

- Salary

- Assignments and Geographical Locations

- Source of Commission

- Military Education Level

- Promotion Sequence Number

- Awards and decorations

- Photograph

- Transcript of Courts-Martial Trials

- Places of entrance and separation

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Glen Shortt

title: Virginia State Open Records Law - Request

communications.communication:
Dear Ms Lee, 

I am writing to ask for your help with a request under the Virginia State Open Records Law, Va Code sec §2.2-3700 - §2.2-3714.

Previously, you kindly sent us Commitment, Contribution, Distribution, Value and IRR as of March 31, 2023 of your private equity and real estate funds. We were extremely grateful to receive this data, as it is very helpful for our research.  

Do you have more recent records, specifically Commitment, Contribution, Distribution, Value and IRR as of June 30, 2023? This list should include all such partnerships, i.e. private equity, venture capital, distressed debt, mezzanine, fund of funds, real estate, natural resources and private debt investments. If so, is it possible for you to send them to us? 

Thank you very much for your help with this request.  I understand that I my be charged for the cost of the copes requested and agree to pay these charges.

title: Ohio Electronic Sex Offender Registration and Notification Database report of Michelle Mathis (Office of the Attorney General - Ohio)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Privacy Act of 1974 and/or FOIA requests, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Ohio Open Records Law, §149.43 et seq., I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records that detail the data/records on all sex offenders for life sentences within the timeframe of years 2011 through 2023.

I request a copy of any records/data held on Michelle Mathis and/or all the identifiable sex offenders for years 2012 through 2023 on record for life sentences  to report at the Ohio Electronic Sex Offender Registration and Notification Database and/or at the Ohio Attorney General  and/or the Bureau of Criminal Identification and Investigation. If the request for the records/data has an  extensive timeframe you may narrow the search of the records/data of the sex offenders with life sentences to the years feasible to complete the request of FOIA and/or Privacy Act of 1974.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Ohio Supervisor of Public Record laws. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, or as the statute requires.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Sincerely,

Michelle Mathis

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Michelle Mathis

 Available Data To explore data already published online from the City of Minneapolis, please visit the Minneapolis Open Government web page. (http://www.minneapolismn.gov/government/open/index.htm)

 How do I get updates about my request? We will provide updates by email. In addition, you can view the status updates of your requests on the OpenCity portal. title: Uranium One Deal (Nuclear Regulatory Commission)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

According to the Treasury Department, CFIUS gathers on a weekly basis to discuss pending transactions.  Please provide all records related to each meeting discussing Uranium One/Rosatom to include all transcripts, memoranda, and other communications regarding the transaction.

Please provide all records relating to the criminal and intelligence investigation into senior managers of Tenex, Tenam, and Rosatom prior to CFIUS approval of the Uranium One transaction in October 2010.

Please provide a copy of all records related to the presentation provided by Uranium One/Rosatom to CFIUS staffers prior to filing a formal notice on August 4, 2010.

Please provide a copy of your agency’s official confirmation to Treasury that the transaction did not raise any unresolved national security concerns.

Please provide all records relating to your agency’s determination that the Uranium One/Rosatom transaction did not raise any unresolved national security concerns.

Please provide all records relating to communications with respect to Secretary Clinton and donations to the Clinton Foundation by parties interested in the Uranium One/Rosatom transaction.

Please provide all records referencing Uranium One, Atomredmetzoloto (ARMZ), Rosatom, Tenex, Tenam, Ian Telfer, Vadim Mikerin, Rennaisance Capital, Igor Sagiryan, Prevezon Holdings, Canada, European Union, Mark Lambert, Transport Logistics International Inc. (TLI), between 2004 and 2018 referring to the Uranium One Deal.

All documents, including communications, relating to interactions between the NRC and the DOE with regard to the 2010 transfer of control of Uranium One to ARMZ and the 2013 purchase of the remaining interests in Uranium One.

All documents, including communications, relating to each export and subsequent transfer of natural uranium produced in the U.S. by Uranium One following the transfer of control of the company to ARMZ in 2010.

All documents, including communications relating to your agency’s determinations that the sale of Uranium One, exports of its uranium, and subsequent transfers between foreign countries did not raise any unresolved national security concerns.

All documents, including communications, relating to your agency’s recommendation to President Obama to resubmit the U.S.-Russia 123 agreement for peaceful nuclear cooperation to Congress for review.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Klum

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Acceleration Protocol
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

An up to date copy of the acceleration protocol referenced in School Board Policy 5170 https://go.boarddocs.com/mi/aaps/Board.nsf/Public?open&id=policies

The relevant section is quoted below:

The Superintendent shall, in cooperation with the Board, provide a protocol for administration, faculty and families when grade acceleration is under consideration This protocol will provide a timeline for decision-making and clearly outline all steps and evidence/documentation required to thoughtfully proceed with such a consideration.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.communication:

communications.communication:
Dear Runa Sandvik:

Thank you for submitting your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to
the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) via email to
FOIA@nara.gov.  Your request concerns *FBI files 14-HQ-599 and 100-HQ-530
serial 215 as a reference*.

Our office handles FOIA and Privacy Act requests for the NARA's
operational records
(records created by this agency).  Since your request is for archival
records (records created by or originated in a different agency, but that
may have been transferred to the legal custody of NARA) to which access may
be restricted, we are forwarding it by this email to our Office of Research
Services, Special Access and FOIA staff who handle FOIA requests for such
archival records.

That office will assign your request a tracking number, and respond
directly to you.  In the future, if you need to follow up with that office,
please contact them at the address below, or electronically via email
(email is preferred).

The National Archives and Records Administration
Special Access and FOIA Staff (RF)
8601 Adelphi Road, Room 5500
College Park, MD 20740

Phone: 301-837-3190
Fax: 301-837-1864
Email: specialaccess_foia@nara.gov

For your reference, a copy of your request is below.

Please visit our website at www.archives.gov/foia  for further information
about making a FOIA request to NARA.  On our main website, www.archives.gov,
you can learn more about the resources that we offer to the public, and you
can access our online catalog.

Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and pursuant to guidance received from the
Office of Management and Budget (OMB), NARA had adjusted its normal
operations to balance the need of completing its mission-critical work
while also adhering to the recommended social distancing for the safety of
our staff. As a result of this re-prioritization of activities, you may
experience a delay in receiving a substantive response to your FOIA
request.  We apologize for this inconvenience and appreciate your
understanding and patience.

Sincerely,

8601 Adelphi Road
College Park, Maryland, 20740-6001
301-837-3642

title: Army Documents on Morsecorp W911QX22C0029 (Army - United States Department of the Army)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

title: NASA support for 2009 film "The Box"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NASA support for 2009 film "The Box"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) and the production of the 2009 movie "The Box," directed by Richard Kelly and starring Cameron Diaz. I request any and all documents pertaining to NASA support for "The Box." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of NASA and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "The Box," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: Request Acknowledgement by NASA Public Access Link
communications.communication:
Dear Brett Carollo, 

Case Number 24-00269-F-HQ was assigned to the request you submitted. You seek the following: 

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) and the production of the 2009 movie "Fast & Furious," directed by Justin Lin and starring Vin Diesel. I request any and all documents pertaining to NASA support for "Fast & Furious." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of NASA and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Fast & Furious," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fnasa-224%252Fnasa-support-for-2009-film-fast-furious-155420%252F%253Femail%253Dadmin%252540ains.com&url_auth_token=AAAXYbpVAPRkftFXqSmH8d7cwbQ%3A1rA0dy%3AoLhtVS037PSCzGz30iBl5VgKf_6NtgmxvEJk_AXazAY 

Please reference case number 24-00269-F-HQ in all future correspondence regarding this reequest.
Regards, 
NASA Public Access Link

title: NASA support for 2007 film "Blades of Glory"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NASA support for 2007 film "Blades of Glory"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) and the production of the 2007 movie "Blades of Glory," directed by Will Speck and starring Will Ferrell. I request any and all documents pertaining to NASA support for "Blades of Glory." Such documents may include but should not be not limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of NASA and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Blades of Glory," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Cell Phone Notes/Records Amy Heavlin

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Cell Phone Notes/Records Amy Heavlin
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any documents stored on any government cellular phone.  To include detailed phone records of all incoming/outgoing phone numbers and any incoming/outgoing SMS/Text messages.  Also all notes and documents stored on any personal phones and/or electronic devices that have been used to promulgate public business including SMS/Text messages, documents, and notes.  Also a copy of all public records requests sent to the City Clerk written or via email.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

John Passmore

title: Saul Zaentz

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Saul Zaentz
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of inquiry or investigation of Saul Zaentz (February 28, 1921 - January 3  2014). Proof of death is not required as his death was widely reported: https://www.nytimes.com/2014/01/05/us/saul-zaentz-producer-of-oscar-winning-movies-dies-at-92.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to

correspondence will be forthcoming.
